content.question:
<math alttext="A l, solid, produces, A l with a positive 3 charge, aqueous, plus, 3 electrons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, 2 electrons, produce, Z n, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

The half-reactions for the oxidation-reduction reaction between <math alttext="A l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are represented above. Based on the half-reactions, what is the coefficient for <math alttext="A l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> if the equation for the oxidation-reduction reaction is balanced with the smallest whole-number coefficients?

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
